body: ### What are you really trying to do? ### Describe the bug CI pipelines fail to install the lowest dependencies versions: It's also reproduces locally, by installing composer with a version greater than 2.9. It seems like composer requires api package (`composer/composer`) as minimum as itself, so composer:^2.9 cannot install 2.8.* api package, so they cannot install internal/promise 2.* versions, and finally pipeline fails. There're several solutions, which may help: - bind composer as maximum of 2.8.* packages - drop internal/promise 2.* versions - ignore composer/composer requirements and allow to install internal/promise v2 Related composer resources: https://github.com/composer/composer/pull/12188#issuecomment-3302159636 https://github.com/composer/composer/commit/4ad19893aa38377fff6a59490d9e6e890090779b ### Minimal Reproduction ### Environment/Versions - OS and processor: [e.g. M1 Mac, x86 Windows, Linux] - Temporal Version: [e.g. 1.14.0?] and/or SDK version - Are you using Docker or Kubernetes or building Temporal from source? ### Additional context
title: [Bug] Minimal Composer requirements conflicts with react/promise v2
